channel.title: Help blending scenes
channel.description: https://app.auxy.co/projects/FKNQtBJVZpNQD6w2MIsdsg== How do you blend the scenes without having the notes initial punch in the second scene and just have a flawless connection like it’s one continuous note

item.title: Help blending scenes
item.dc:creator: BHR
item.description:
Here’s what I did: https://app.auxy.co/projects/mHxz7nNdYWtPV1p9Rt9ddA==

I create a separate project and transferred the sound there. Next I delayed the pitch rise by 1 bar, as well as the volume. Next I used the separate project as a sample in a drum kit.

I’m not sure how to explain it exactly, but I hope it helps

Read full topic

item.title: Help blending scenes
item.dc:creator: Eswyn
item.description:
There is no way to ‘flawlessly’ do this due to Auxy’s limitations with scenes. There are many tricks like the ones mentioned above. Typical DAWs don’t have this issue, but for Auxy you’ll just have to use workarounds like these because of the way it’s programmed.

Read full topic

item.title: Help blending scenes
item.dc:creator: Jax
item.description:
If you don’t want that punch, I suggest adding maybe 10 ms of attack.

Read full topic

item.title: Help blending scenes
item.dc:creator: Osharu
item.description:
Have you tried something like a weird first of every bar ducker that could take away some of the initial punch of the note?
Something sorta like this:
https://app.auxy.co/projects/OeOLMF8ni6MvVkrwBSVa4A==

Also, worth noting this goes in the “Work in Progress” tabs, instead of the “Random” tab

Read full topic
